bibl.title: Gwoo Shee Ah Look vs. United States. Petition.
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

msIdentifier.repository: National Archives and Records Administration, Seattle Branch, Washington
msIdentifier.collection: RG 21: US District Court, Western Division of Washington, Seatle

div1.p: 2647 In the District Court of the United States For the Western District of Washington Northern Division.
In the matterof the Application for a Writ of Habeas Corpus for Gwoo Shee Ah Look.
To the Hon. Jeremiah Neterer, Judge of said Court:

Your petitionr, Wong Sing Lung, respectfully shows to the Court that he is an alien by birth but has been domiciled within the United States for many years, and that Gwoo Shee Ah Look, who has been termed Ah Sing, alias Gwoo Shee, alias Gwoo Ah Look, by the United States to China by the Secretary of Commerce and Labor of the United States and that said Secretary of Commerce and Labor has issued his warrant directed to R.P. Bonham, Acting Inspector of Immigration Service at Portland, Oregon, for the deportation of said Gwoo Shee Ah Look;

Your petitioner further shows that he is informed and believes, and therefore says that the said R.P. Bonham as Acting Insepctor of Immigration Service of Portland, Oregon, has caused the said Gwoo Shee Ah Look to be removed from Portland, Oregon, to the City of Seattle, State of Washington, where she is now held by some person, the name of whom and the place of which is unknown to your petitioner; that the said Gwoo Shee Ah Look is unlawfully restrained, imprisoned and detained of her liberty by the said R.P. Bonham and ther persons, the name of whom is unknown to your petitioner -1-
Wilbur & Spencer Attorneys-At-Law Portland Oregon
and that the said R.P. Bonham clandestinely, secretly, and without authority of law removed the said Gwoo Shee Ah Look from the county jail of the County of Multnomah and State of Oregon, and clandestinely and secretly detained her and has refused upon the application of the said Gwoo Shee Ah Look, as well as that of her husband, Wong Sing Lung, to let it be known where she is detained.

Your petitioner further shows that he, together with his representative, who is the representative of Gwoo Shee Ah Look, has applied to the said R.P. Bonham, Acting Inspector of Immigration Service at Portland, Oregon, and requested the said R.P. Bonham to advise or tell them the whereabouts of the said Gwoo Shee Ah Look, but that the said R.P. Bonham has frauduently refused to let it be known where she or the person in whose custody he has placed the said Gwoo Shee Ah Look is located;

Your petitioner further shows that the said Gwoo Shee Ah Look is an alien and by birth a Chinese and that she arrived in this country at the port of San Francisco on the Steamer Siberia, during the year 1907, since which time she has been continously domiciled within the Untied States, and your petitioner further shows that the said Gwoo Shee Ah Look is now unlawfully imprisioned, detained, confined, and restrained by certain persons under the authority of the said R.P. Bonham, and the said Secretary of Commerce and Labor, the name of whom is unknown to your petitioner;

That a hearing was had before the United States Commissioner at the City of Portland, Oregon, who thereafter made his report to the Secretary of Commerce and Labor, and that acting upon the evidence taken by said Commissioner at the City of Portland, and which was forwarded to the Secretary of Commerce and Labor, the said Secretary of Commerce and Labor has ordered said Gwoo Shee Ah Look's deportation to China and found "That the said alien is a prostitute and has been found practicing prostitution subsequent to her entry into the United States."

Your petitioner further shows that said Gwoo Shee Ah Look is being held by the said R.H. Bonham, Acting Inspector of Immigration Service at Portland, Oregon, or by someone to whom the said R.P. Bonham has turned the said Gwoo Shee Ah Look over to for deportation, as directed by the said warrant of the said Secretary of Commerce and Labor for deportation to her native country, China, and that they are about to and will deport her to her native country,

Your petitioner further shows that the said imprisonment, detention, confinement, and restraint and order fo deportation are illegal, and that the illegality thereof consists in this, that there was no evidence before said Commissioner or Secretary of Commerce and Labor authorizing the order for said Gwoo Shee Ah Look's deportation;

That the only evidence there was before either the Commissioner of the Secretary of Commerce and Labor on behalf of the Government was the testimony of L.A. Harms, who is a Sergeant of Police of the City of Portland, and whose testimony, so far as the virtue of said Gwoo Shee Ah Look is concerned, is substantially as -3-
Wilbur & Spencer Attorneys-At-Law Portland Oregon
follows:-
"Q When and where did you first see this woman?" (Gwoo Shee Ah Look)
"A About three weeks ago, about two weeks before her arrest was made, upstairs, second floor, in a building on the southwest corner of Fourth and Flanders Streets, this city.
"Q Under what circumstances did you see her at that time?

"A We were investigating that place, knowing that there were Chinese prostitutes up there, about two or three weeks before the arrest was made; we were up there three or four times; Officer Wise and myself."
"Q State briefly what you saw on the occasion of these two investigations, so far as your observation is limited to this woman.

"A In the first place, we had information from different sources that there were Chinese prostitutes up there. We watched the place on several different occasions and saw Chinese going up there in the rooms that the women were in. We went up there and talked to the women the best we could. At different times we found different men in this woman's room. Finally, about 4:30 in the morning November 4th, we went up with the purpose of making her arrest and we found a Chinese in bed with her.

"Q In your capacity, experience, and observation as a police officer in the Chinese quarter on North Fourth Street, Portland, what have you found to be the reputation of the place out of which this womna was arrested?
"A It has the reputation of being a bawdyhouse where prostitutes ply their trade."
Wilbur & Spencer Attorneys-At-Law Portland Oregon
And the testimony of J.M. Wise, who is a police officerof the City of Portland, whose testimony so far as the virtue of said Gwoo Shee Ah Look is concerned, is substaintially as follows:-
"Q When, where and under what circumstances did you first see or meet this woman?" (Gwoo Shee Ah Look)
"A Along about the 20th of October, this year, in room 17 of a building on the southwest corner of Fourth and Flanders Street, this city."(Portland)
"Q Under what circumstances did you first see her?
A Investifating the place, gaining evidence as to this place being a house of prostitution and as to this woman being a prostitute.
"Q Did you arrest this woman?
"A Yes, on the 4th day of November, about 4:30 in the morning"

That there was no other testimony on behalf of the Governmnet of questions or character from which prostitution is hsown or which shows that Gwoo Shee Ah Look is a prostitute in the record of this case.
Your petitioner further says that said Gwoo Shee Ah Look is not a prostitute and that said Gwoo Shee Ah Look has not practiced prostitution within the United States, or at any other place;

Your petitioner further shows that the evidence before the said Commissioner and the Secretary of Commerce and Labor showed in substance that said Gwoo Shee Ah Look came to the State of Oregon on the 8th day of October, 1913, with her husband; that they resided at a hotel in the City of Portland form that time until the 15th day of October, 1913, when said Gwoo Shee Ah Look went to live with a respectable Chinese family, where she remained until the first day of November, 1913, at which time, she, together with her husband, rented a room at the place where said Gwoo Shee Ah Look was arrested.

Your petitoner futher shows that the affidavits in behalf of said Gwoo Shee Ah Look showed in substance that she had not been in the room or at the place where she was arrested until the first day of November, 1913, when she moved there with her husband;

Your petitioner further shows that the facts as above detailed were shown in the affidavits of Wong Sing Lung, Sue Key Line, Wong Shee, Wong Ark, D. L. Huston and Walter Bartholemew, all of which were filed with the Commissioner in the City of Portland, attached to the record, and before the said Secretary of Commerce and Labor;

Your petitioner further shows that the sole and only testimony upon which the said Secretary of Commerce and Labor has ordered the deportation of said Gwoo Shee Ah Look was the testimony of said two policemen, the substance of which has been set out herein, and that their testimony that they saw her at the place of her arrest prior to the first day of November, 1913, is untrue and a case of mistakedn identity.

Wherefore, your petitioner prays that a writ of habeas corpus may be grantedf, directed to the person who unlawfully restrains the liberty of the said Gwoo Shee Ah Look, the name of whom is unknown to your petitioner, commanding him to have the body of said Gwoo Shee Ah Look before your Honor at the time and place hereafter to be specified, to do and recieve what shall then and there be considered by your Honor concerning her, together with the time and cause of her detention and said writ and that she may be restored to her liberty.
div1.ab: Wilbur & Spencer A.L. Clark & Jesse A Frye Attorneys
div1.p: United States of America, State of Oregon, County of Multnomah } ss.

I, Wong Sing Lung, being first duly sworn according to law, say that I am the husband of Gwoo Shee Ah Look, the person who is unlawfully restrained of her liberty; that I am informed and believe and therefore say that my said wife, Gwoo Shee Ah Look, is detained and restrained by some person upon the authority of R.P. Bonham, Acting Inspector of Immigration Service at Portland, Oregon, upon a warrant for her deportation to China, the name of the person having the custody of the said Gwoo Shee Ah Look being unknown to me; that the said Gwoo Shee Ah Look was clandestinely, secretly and fraudulently removed from the City of Portland, State of Oregon, to the City of Seattle, State of Washington, where she is now unlawfully restrained of her liberty; that the said R.P. Bonham, on the 12th day of January 1914, was requested by the attorney of the said Gwoo Shee Ah Look and myself to advise of the present whereabouts of the said Gwoo Shee Ah Look, which request was summarily refused by the said R.P. Bonham, which makes it -7-
Wilbur & Spencer Attorneys-At-Law Portland Oregon
impossible for Gwoo Shee Ah Look to verify this petition and for this reason I am verifying this petition; that I have had the same read to me and know the contents thereof to be true.
Subscribed and sworn to beforeme this 12th day of January 1914.
div1.ab: SC Spever Notary Public State of Oregon.
div1.p: In teh District Court of the United States for the District of Oregon Washington
In the matter of the application for a writ of Habeas Corpus for Gwoo Shee Ah Look
Filed in the U.S. District Court, Western Dist. of Washington, Northern Division Jan 13 1914 Frank L. Crosby, Clerk, By EML Deputy.
Wilbur & Spencer Attorneys for
